direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are part of the Iterator interface and are closely related in functionality, with hasNext() determining if there is a next element and next() retrieving it.
Both methods involve checking and setting the next node, with maybeFindNext() being a helper method for hasNext().
Both methods involve finding the next node in the iteration, with findNextNode() being a helper method for maybeFindNext().
Both methods are part of the Iterator interface and involve operations on the current node, though remove() modifies the node while hasNext() does not.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require the iterator to be initialized or restarted from a specific node.
next() must be invoked after hasNext() to retrieve the next element, maintaining the correct execution order.
findNextNode() can be used to verify the correctness of the next node found by hasNext().
